html: Heartbroken to learn of another violent anti-Semitic attack — this time, at a Synagogue in Poway, California, on the last day of Passover. Another community devastated by an act of gun violence at their place of worship. This hate-fueled violence has no place in our society.https://twitter.com/abc/status/1122253453894586368 …
text:
Heartbroken to learn of another violent anti-Semitic attack — this time, at a Synagogue in Poway, California, on the last day of Passover.

Another community devastated by an act of gun violence at their place of worship.

This hate-fueled violence has no place in our society.https://twitter.com/abc/status/1122253453894586368 …

html: Visited @GeorgiaGuard Language Training Center to learn more about regional, state, nat'l, & international programs at Clay National Guard Center in Marietta that ensure we are prepared for disasters & that our military personnel have cutting edge training to keep us safe. #GA06pic.twitter.com/0496b93Xa2
text: Visited @GeorgiaGuard Language Training Center to learn more about regional, state, nat'l, & international programs at Clay National Guard Center in Marietta that ensure we are prepared for disasters & that our military personnel have cutting edge training to keep us safe. #GA06pic.twitter.com/0496b93Xa2

html: My thanks to @Elekta for inviting me to visit with your team at your U.S. headquarters in Dunwoody! As a two-time cancer survivor, I appreciate your commitment to advancing technologies in precision radiation medicine to improve the patient experience, lower costs, & save lives.pic.twitter.com/mIlhoMXlyH
text:
My thanks to @Elekta for inviting me to visit with your team at your U.S. headquarters in Dunwoody!

As a two-time cancer survivor, I appreciate your commitment to advancing technologies in precision radiation medicine to improve the patient experience, lower costs, & save lives.pic.twitter.com/mIlhoMXlyH

html: Glad to have been able to meet with Georgia’s @AARP team for a discussion about protecting Medicare, expanding access to health care, & lowering prescription drug costs. Thank you for supporting my Saving for the Future Act - to give more workers access to a secure retirement.pic.twitter.com/Z33JM3BxdK
text:
Glad to have been able to meet with Georgia’s @AARP team for a discussion about protecting Medicare, expanding access to health care, & lowering prescription drug costs.
 
Thank you for supporting my Saving for the Future Act - to give more workers access to a secure retirement.pic.twitter.com/Z33JM3BxdK

html: Happy #EarthDay! We can all do our part to preserve our environment and our planet for future generations. Let’s work to protect #GA06’s natural beauty. And let’s recommit ourselves as a nation to #ActOnClimate.pic.twitter.com/JzpMJhoWxw

Happy #EarthDay!

We can all do our part to preserve our environment and our planet for future generations.

Let’s work to protect #GA06’s natural beauty.

And let’s recommit ourselves as a nation to #ActOnClimate.pic.twitter.com/JzpMJhoWxw

html: 20 years ago, 13 lives were lost in the tragic shooting at Columbine High School. Our thoughts are with the survivors & families who lost loved ones as we work to #EndGunViolence in all its forms & keep others from knowing the pain of losing a child or loved one to gun violence.pic.twitter.com/qIpzkP1FoB
text:
20 years ago, 13 lives were lost in the tragic shooting at Columbine High School.

Our thoughts are with the survivors & families who lost loved ones as we work to #EndGunViolence in all its forms & keep others from knowing the pain of losing a child or loved one to gun violence.pic.twitter.com/qIpzkP1FoB

html: To all those celebrating Passover, Chag Sameach! Honored to spend the evening celebrating alongside our friends and neighbors in the local Jewish community at the annual Passover Seder led by Rabbi Lebow at Temple Kol Emeth in East Cobb tonight.pic.twitter.com/wVhoULuEMW
text:

html: Black women are four times more likely to die from preventable pregnancy complications than white women. This is a public health crisis that needs to be addressed. #BlackMamasMatter #BMHCaucus #BlackMaternalHealthWeekpic.twitter.com/no5h26uklV
text:
Black women are four times more likely to die from preventable pregnancy complications than white women.

This is a public health crisis that needs to be addressed.

#BlackMamasMatter #BMHCaucus #BlackMaternalHealthWeekpic.twitter.com/no5h26uklV

html: The number one way that women in America are being killed by their intimate partners is with a gun. Today I will vote YES to reauthorize #VAWA and close the boyfriend loophole – to prevent abusers and stalkers from having firearms. #VAWA19pic.twitter.com/rNFxCRWEmu
text:
The number one way that women in America are being killed by their intimate partners is with a gun.

Today I will vote YES to reauthorize #VAWA and close the boyfriend loophole – to prevent abusers and stalkers from having firearms.

#VAWA19pic.twitter.com/rNFxCRWEmu

html: With the passage of #HR8 and #HR1112 in the House, we are taking action to #EndGunViolence by expanding #BackgroundChecks. I am hopeful that the era of complacency in the face of gun violence is coming to an end. #EnoughIsEnough @bradybuzz
text:
With the passage of #HR8 and #HR1112 in the House, we are taking action to #EndGunViolence by expanding #BackgroundChecks.

I am hopeful that the era of complacency in the face of gun violence is coming to an end.

#EnoughIsEnough @bradybuzz

html: #OTD in 1981, WH Press Sec James Brady was shot in the head & paralyzed for life in an assassination attempt on President Reagan. The President & 2 officers were also shot. Brady dedicated his life to passing the #BradyBill - the 1st federal background check bill for gun sales.pic.twitter.com/elDun2zA8P
text:
#OTD in 1981, WH Press Sec James Brady was shot in the head & paralyzed for life in an assassination attempt on President Reagan. The President & 2 officers were also shot.

Brady dedicated his life to passing the #BradyBill - the 1st federal background check bill for gun sales.pic.twitter.com/elDun2zA8P

html: I came to Congress to protect Georgians with pre-existing conditions and to make healthcare more affordable. Proud to have joined @HouseDemocrats yesterday in taking a major step to #ProtectOurCare
text:
I came to Congress to protect Georgians with pre-existing conditions and to make healthcare more affordable. 

Proud to have joined @HouseDemocrats yesterday in taking a major step to #ProtectOurCare

html: Two tragedies, after countless others, brought us to today. My son was torn from my life. An act of gun violence took 17 lives in Parkland. We will keep fighting to keep our communities safe. I pray that a year from now we can look back on the progress we’ve made.pic.twitter.com/1QlErdm85C
text:
Two tragedies, after countless others, brought us to today. My son was torn from my life. An act of gun violence took 17 lives in Parkland.

We will keep fighting to keep our communities safe.

I pray that a year from now we can look back on the progress we’ve made.pic.twitter.com/1QlErdm85C

html: One year ago, @AMarch4OurLives began. These students turned their pain into action – they shared their stories – and the world listened. A year later, the nation is finally taking meaningful, bipartisan action to make our country a safer place. #YourComplacencyKillsUspic.twitter.com/mnulfO9xNc
text:
One year ago, @AMarch4OurLives began. These students turned their pain into action – they shared their stories – and the world listened.

A year later, the nation is finally taking meaningful, bipartisan action to make our country a safer place.

#YourComplacencyKillsUspic.twitter.com/mnulfO9xNc

html: Today, we #MarchForOurLives. This day in history belongs to us. See you out there! https://marchforourlives.com/ pic.twitter.com/NSFh4GPov6

html: I am so sorry. If you are hurting and need help, know that you are not alone. Please reach out. The suicide hotline number is 1-800-273-8255.https://twitter.com/MiamiHerald/status/1109832695998230534 …
text: I am so sorry. If you are hurting and need help, know that you are not alone. Please reach out. The suicide hotline number is 1-800-273-8255.https://twitter.com/MiamiHerald/status/1109832695998230534 …

html: Thank you to the Cobb County-Marietta Water Authority, the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, and the Atlanta Regional Commission, for the tour and lesson in hydroelectric power & water conservation and management. Plus, the views were great! pic.twitter.com/pYj7nqgJQd
text: Thank you to the Cobb County-Marietta Water Authority, the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, and the Atlanta Regional Commission, for the tour and lesson in hydroelectric power & water conservation and management. Plus, the views were great! pic.twitter.com/pYj7nqgJQd

html: I toured the Lake Allatoona Dam and Hickory Log Creek Reservoir to learn more about where Cobb County and Marietta get their water.pic.twitter.com/nsaw1AN8Nu
text: I toured the Lake Allatoona Dam and Hickory Log Creek Reservoir to learn more about where Cobb County and Marietta get their water.pic.twitter.com/nsaw1AN8Nu

html: The #ACA provides protections for the 130 million people w/ pre-existing conditions, including over 4 million Georgians. As a two-time cancer survivor, I know how important it is that we protect Americans with pre-existing conditions, expand coverage, & lower health care costs.
text:
The #ACA provides protections for the 130 million people w/ pre-existing conditions, including over 4 million Georgians.

As a two-time cancer survivor, I know how important it is that we protect Americans with pre-existing conditions, expand coverage, & lower health care costs.

html: Nine years ago, the Affordable Care Act (#ACA) was signed into law. Since then, more than 20 million uninsured Americans have gained quality, affordable health insurance coverage. #ACAanniversarypic.twitter.com/AVMaaRjrDK
text:
Nine years ago, the Affordable Care Act (#ACA) was signed into law.

Since then, more than 20 million uninsured Americans have gained quality, affordable health insurance coverage.

#ACAanniversarypic.twitter.com/AVMaaRjrDK

html: Now that Mueller has completed his report, Attorney General Barr must #ReleaseTheReport to the public. The American people have a right to the truth.
text: Now that Mueller has completed his report, Attorney General Barr must #ReleaseTheReport to the public. The American people have a right to the truth.

html: The Republican-controlled Senate joined the House in rejecting the President's unwarranted emergency declaration. This veto circumvents the will of the people, and I will vote to override it and restore the balance of power our framers intended.https://twitter.com/NPR/status/1106646359829024769 …
text: The Republican-controlled Senate joined the House in rejecting the President's unwarranted emergency declaration. This veto circumvents the will of the people, and I will vote to override it and restore the balance of power our framers intended.https://twitter.com/NPR/status/1106646359829024769 …

html: Horrified by the attacks in Christchurch – my heart aches for the lives lost at the hands of violent hatred. My thoughts are with the victims and their families, the people of New Zealand, and the global Muslim community.
text: Horrified by the attacks in Christchurch – my heart aches for the lives lost at the hands of violent hatred. My thoughts are with the victims and their families, the people of New Zealand, and the global Muslim community.

html: Last week, Argosy’s Atlanta campus closed, disrupting the lives of 1,500 students. Today, I led a letter with 84 colleagues - including @RepJayapal @RepSusieLee @RepSusanDavis - to @USEdGov, urging them to help protect students affected by these closures. Students deserve better.pic.twitter.com/LZvGC5eH5Q
text: Last week, Argosy’s Atlanta campus closed, disrupting the lives of 1,500 students. Today, I led a letter with 84 colleagues - including @RepJayapal @RepSusieLee @RepSusanDavis - to @USEdGov, urging them to help protect students affected by these closures. Students deserve better.pic.twitter.com/LZvGC5eH5Q

html: I’m proud to co-sponsor #HR5, the #EqualityAct, to extend federal civil rights protections to LGBTQ Americans. No one should face discrimination because of who they are or who they love.pic.twitter.com/zFRlpHTAcc
text:
I’m proud to co-sponsor #HR5, the #EqualityAct, to extend federal civil rights protections to LGBTQ Americans.

No one should face discrimination because of who they are or who they love.pic.twitter.com/zFRlpHTAcc

html: It is one thing to get a student to college. It is another to get them through college. I’m excited that today's bipartisan hearing in @EdLaborCmte regarding higher education was the first of many. I look forward to continuing these conversations. #TheValueofCollegepic.twitter.com/sFgVInE55c
text:
It is one thing to get a student to college. It is another to get them through college.
 
I’m excited that today's bipartisan hearing in @EdLaborCmte regarding higher education was the first of many.
 
I look forward to continuing these conversations.
 
#TheValueofCollegepic.twitter.com/sFgVInE55c

text: Yesterday, I joined my colleagues in introducing legislation to reauthorize #VAWA, the Violence Against Women Act. I was honored to do so during #WomensHistoryMonth and as we celebrate #InternationalWomensDay today.https://twitter.com/nowthisnews/status/1104064988136726530 …

text:
Empowered women, empower women!

From the Women of the #CBC to all of the women around the world. Happy #InternationalWomensDaypic.twitter.com/AIgJ2HOKYH

html: Today, we will vote on #HR1, the #ForThePeople Act. This bold, historic legislation will put the power back in the hands of the American people, and it will restore the public’s faith that their government works for them - not special interests.pic.twitter.com/P0d598dvmq
text:
Today, we will vote on #HR1, the #ForThePeople Act.

This bold, historic legislation will put the power back in the hands of the American people, and it will restore the public’s faith that their government works for them - not special interests.pic.twitter.com/P0d598dvmq

html: At 9 am ET, House Democrats will gather ahead of passing #HR1, the #ForThePeople Act, a historic package of democracy reforms, ethics standards, and voting protections. Tune in here: https://goo.gl/sDDJd3
text: At 9 am ET, House Democrats will gather ahead of passing #HR1, the #ForThePeople Act, a historic package of democracy reforms, ethics standards, and voting protections. Tune in here: https://goo.gl/sDDJd3

html: It was an honor to preside over part of our @HouseJudiciary Subcommittee hearing on the Violence Against Women Act (#VAWA) today. #VAWA19 is essential to helping survivors. We must reauthorize it NOW.pic.twitter.com/X8xWBABWA7
text:
It was an honor to preside over part of our @HouseJudiciary Subcommittee hearing on the Violence Against Women Act (#VAWA) today.

#VAWA19 is essential to helping survivors. We must reauthorize it NOW.pic.twitter.com/X8xWBABWA7

fullname: The Caucus on Black Women & Girls
html: As of January 2019, there are are a record number of black women serving in Congress. Their faces remind us that representation matters and so does each vote. They stand as a reminder that Still We Rise!pic.twitter.com/UFzxRK9ISP
text:
As of January 2019, there are are a record number of black women serving in Congress.
Their faces remind us that representation matters and so does each vote.
They stand as a reminder that Still We Rise!pic.twitter.com/UFzxRK9ISP

html: This week, #HR1112, the Expanded Background Checks Act of 2019, passed the House with bipartisan support. We are working to close loopholes and ensure the safety of all Americans - we are making progress to reduce gun violence. I hope my colleagues in the Senate will join us.pic.twitter.com/gwRWElf01g
text:
This week, #HR1112, the Expanded Background Checks Act of 2019, passed the House with bipartisan support.

We are working to close loopholes and ensure the safety of all Americans - we are making progress to reduce gun violence.

I hope my colleagues in the Senate will join us.pic.twitter.com/gwRWElf01g

html: I couldn’t be more thrilled to serve alongside so many inspiring women who fearlessly dedicate their lives to public service. #WomensHistoryMonthpic.twitter.com/5Hv6wU7i45
text: I couldn’t be more thrilled to serve alongside so many inspiring women who fearlessly dedicate their lives to public service. #WomensHistoryMonthpic.twitter.com/5Hv6wU7i45

text: I’ll be on @CNN with @donlemon at 10:30PM to discuss the passage of #HR8 & #HR1112 and the historic 116th Congress.pic.twitter.com/JGyTNI4EVc

html: Again, @HouseDemocrats have cut through years of GOP inaction by passing #HR1112. This commonsense legislation closes the dangerous #CharlestonLoophole and brings us one step closer to ending the crisis of gun violence in our country.pic.twitter.com/TFpLg1ii0G
text: Again, @HouseDemocrats have cut through years of GOP inaction by passing #HR1112. This commonsense legislation closes the dangerous #CharlestonLoophole and brings us one step closer to ending the crisis of gun violence in our country.pic.twitter.com/TFpLg1ii0G

html: Today #HR8 passed the House, marking a pivotal moment in our fight to #EndGunViolence and to ensure the safety of every community across our nation. This is progress. I want to thank my colleagues on both sides of the aisle who are making the safety of all Americans a priority.pic.twitter.com/TSR2mez7vX
text:
Today #HR8 passed the House, marking a pivotal moment in our fight to #EndGunViolence and to ensure the safety of every community across our nation.

This is progress. I want to thank my colleagues on both sides of the aisle who are making the safety of all Americans a priority.pic.twitter.com/TSR2mez7vX

html: Congress has the power and the duty to act and restore protections against racial discrimination in voting. We must act to #RestoreTheVotepic.twitter.com/JWOSMkmIEh
text: Congress has the power and the duty to act and restore protections against racial discrimination in voting. We must act to #RestoreTheVotepic.twitter.com/JWOSMkmIEh

html: The Committee has APPROVED the Paycheck Fairness Act! (27 Yeas-19 Nays) This bill strengthens protections against gender-based workplace discrimination to ensure all women receive #EqualPayforEqualWork.pic.twitter.com/bw2i59kGd5
text:
The Committee has APPROVED the Paycheck Fairness Act! (27 Yeas-19 Nays) 
This bill strengthens protections against gender-based workplace discrimination to ensure all women receive #EqualPayforEqualWork.pic.twitter.com/bw2i59kGd5

html: I look forward to joining @ChrisMurphyCT as well as gun violence survivors and experts for a Town Hall TONIGHT at 7pm to discuss universal background checks. To watch live and submit your questions: https://bit.ly/2EkyzMQ  #BackgroundChecksNow
text:
I look forward to joining @ChrisMurphyCT as well as gun violence survivors and experts for a Town Hall TONIGHT at 7pm to discuss universal background checks.

To watch live and submit your questions: https://bit.ly/2EkyzMQ  #BackgroundChecksNow

html: Thank you to our neighbors and members of the community who joined me this afternoon to discuss common-sense solutions to #EndGunViolence. I look forward to voting “YES” when #HR8 comes to the floor of the House this week.pic.twitter.com/PhnBoeCGCK
text:
Thank you to our neighbors and members of the community who joined me this afternoon to discuss common-sense solutions to #EndGunViolence.

I look forward to voting “YES” when #HR8 comes to the floor of the House this week.pic.twitter.com/PhnBoeCGCK

html: The pain of losing a child to gun violence never goes away. I know – it's that pain which drives me every day in my work to prevent gun violence. Next week, we will take an important step as the House holds a vote on H.R. 8, the Bipartisan Background Checks Act of 2019.pic.twitter.com/2QTuEWnkaf
text:
The pain of losing a child to gun violence never goes away. I know – it's that pain which drives me every day in my work to prevent gun violence.

Next week, we will take an important step as the House holds a vote on H.R. 8, the Bipartisan Background Checks Act of 2019.pic.twitter.com/2QTuEWnkaf

html: Today we honor and recognize the nearly 100 men and women arrested during the #MontgomeryBusBoycott. But we also ought not forget about Sarah Mae Flemming, whose refusal to give up her seat on a Columbia, SC bus originated the integration of public transportation. #BHMpic.twitter.com/04jXtTzJtd
text:
Today we honor and recognize the nearly 100 men and women arrested during the #MontgomeryBusBoycott.

But we also ought not forget about Sarah Mae Flemming, whose refusal to give up her seat on a Columbia, SC bus originated the integration of public transportation. #BHMpic.twitter.com/04jXtTzJtd

html: It was great to join the students at Lakeside High School during their #BlackHistoryMonth program. It energizes my fight in Washington to see students involved in democratic discourse. Thank you for sharing your day!pic.twitter.com/eRgtmqbOyV
text:
It was great to join the students at Lakeside High School during their #BlackHistoryMonth program. It energizes my fight in Washington to see students involved in democratic discourse.

Thank you for sharing your day!pic.twitter.com/eRgtmqbOyV

html: Happy birthday, @repjohnlewis! It is an honor to serve the state of Georgia with you. pic.twitter.com/mo1g8CsqSs
text: Happy birthday, @repjohnlewis! It is an honor to serve the state of Georgia with you. pic.twitter.com/mo1g8CsqSs

html: Today would have been Jordan’s 24th birthday. I am honoring my son’s life by working for common sense solutions to end gun violence and save as many lives as possible. Happy birthday, Jordan. #EndGunViolencepic.twitter.com/vBkhIahYKm
text:
Today would have been Jordan’s 24th birthday.

I am honoring my son’s life by working for common sense solutions to end gun violence and save as many lives as possible.

Happy birthday, Jordan.

#EndGunViolencepic.twitter.com/vBkhIahYKm

html: My heart is with the #Aurora community and the five families who now know the pain of losing a loved one to gun violence. I will continue to fight in Congress to #EndGunViolence and keep others from feeling the pain too many of us know too well.https://twitter.com/AP/status/1096555900259713025 …
text: My heart is with the #Aurora community and the five families who now know the pain of losing a loved one to gun violence. I will continue to fight in Congress to #EndGunViolence and keep others from feeling the pain too many of us know too well.https://twitter.com/AP/status/1096555900259713025 …

html: As we wait for details from #Aurora, our thoughts are with all who are waiting for news about their loved ones, and we send our thanks to the first responders. But we know that we need more than thoughts and prayers to keep us safe. #EndGunViolence #EnoughIsEnoughhttps://twitter.com/RepUnderwood/status/1096522076817625088 …
text:
As we wait for details from #Aurora, our thoughts are with all who are waiting for news about their loved ones, and we send our thanks to the first responders.

But we know that we need more than thoughts and prayers to keep us safe. #EndGunViolence #EnoughIsEnoughhttps://twitter.com/RepUnderwood/status/1096522076817625088 …

html: I haven’t been here long, but I know that Congress – not the President – has the power of the purse. This #FakeEmergency declaration over a crisis that does not exist undermines our system of checks and balances and steals taxpayer funds that are meant to keep our nation safe.
text:
I haven’t been here long, but I know that Congress – not the President – has the power of the purse.

This #FakeEmergency declaration over a crisis that does not exist undermines our system of checks and balances and steals taxpayer funds that are meant to keep our nation safe.

html: Today, we remember the 17 students and staff members who were killed one year ago at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School. We must take meaningful action to #EndGunViolence. #NeverAgain #MSDStrongTodaypic.twitter.com/Cznn2a5xnJ
text:
Today, we remember the 17 students and staff members who were killed one year ago at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School.

We must take meaningful action to #EndGunViolence.

#NeverAgain #MSDStrongTodaypic.twitter.com/Cznn2a5xnJ

html: Today we took an historic step toward passing #HR8 and expanding background checks to help keep our communities safe from gun violence. Here’s a message from today’s markup that I wanted to share.pic.twitter.com/rvk87SM9GV
text: Today we took an historic step toward passing #HR8 and expanding background checks to help keep our communities safe from gun violence. Here’s a message from today’s markup that I wanted to share.pic.twitter.com/rvk87SM9GV

html: “For my son Jordan, I vote aye,” said @RepLucyMcBath, our former spokesperson whose son was shot and killed over loud music at a Florida gas station in 2012.pic.twitter.com/Q8c5iE2MNp
text: “For my son Jordan, I vote aye,” said @RepLucyMcBath, our former spokesperson whose son was shot and killed over loud music at a Florida gas station in 2012.pic.twitter.com/Q8c5iE2MNp

html: BREAKING: @HouseJudiciary just passed #HR1112, the Enhanced Background Checks Act. This bill addresses a loophole that contributed to the tragic hate-crime murder of nine people at the Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church in Charleston, SC in 2015. #EndGunViolence
text: BREAKING: @HouseJudiciary just passed #HR1112, the Enhanced Background Checks Act. This bill addresses a loophole that contributed to the tragic hate-crime murder of nine people at the Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church in Charleston, SC in 2015. #EndGunViolence

html: Thank you for being there. We are making history. We can do this. This is only the beginning. #HR8 #EnoughIsEnoughhttps://twitter.com/RepJahanaHayes/status/1095860250727596032 …
text:
Thank you for being there.

We are making history.

We can do this. This is only the beginning.

#HR8
#EnoughIsEnoughhttps://twitter.com/RepJahanaHayes/status/1095860250727596032 …

html: It was a powerful moment tonight when we passed #HR8 and #HR1112 out of the @HouseJudiciary Committee. These bills would be the first major gun legislation in decades. Next step: the floor of the U.S. House. The fight has just begun. We can #EndGunViolence.https://twitter.com/RepMGS/status/1095858054120333313 …
text:
It was a powerful moment tonight when we passed #HR8 and #HR1112 out of the @HouseJudiciary Committee.

These bills would be the first major gun legislation in decades.

Next step: the floor of the U.S. House.

The fight has just begun. We can #EndGunViolence.https://twitter.com/RepMGS/status/1095858054120333313 …

html: I just voted in @HouseJudiciary to send universal background check legislation to the House Floor for a vote. This is long overdue. #HR8pic.twitter.com/gkbMrFYqsA
text:
I just voted in @HouseJudiciary to send universal background check legislation to the House Floor for a vote. 

This is long overdue. 

#HR8pic.twitter.com/gkbMrFYqsA

html: BREAKING: @HouseJudiciary just passed #HR8 the Bipartisan Background Checks Act. This is the first major gun violence prevention legislation to pass the Committee in several decades. #EndGunViolence
text: BREAKING: @HouseJudiciary just passed #HR8 the Bipartisan Background Checks Act. This is the first major gun violence prevention legislation to pass the Committee in several decades. #EndGunViolence

html: It’s past 7pm. In @HouseJudiciary we are still marking up #HR8 so that we can bring this historic gun violence prevention legislation to the floor of the House. @MomsDemand volunteers have been here since 10am. Their commitment to #EndGunViolence is inspiring.pic.twitter.com/3edbF4bci8
text:
It’s past 7pm.

In @HouseJudiciary we are still marking up #HR8 so that we can bring this historic gun violence prevention legislation to the floor of the House.

@MomsDemand volunteers have been here since 10am.

Their commitment to #EndGunViolence is inspiring.pic.twitter.com/3edbF4bci8

html: I have been working with victims for six years. I have been working on this legislation for six years. I refuse to let anyone challenge this bill as legislation that is not germane to saving as many lives as we possibly can. #HR8 #EndGunViolencepic.twitter.com/FuSh6lLLJL
text:
I have been working with victims for six years. I have been working on this legislation for six years.

I refuse to let anyone challenge this bill as legislation that is not germane to saving as many lives as we possibly can.

#HR8 #EndGunViolencepic.twitter.com/FuSh6lLLJL

html: It was my honor to preside over the Chamber as @RepTedDeutch led a moment of silence before reading the names of the 17 who were killed in the shooting at Stoneman Douglas HS in Parkland last year. I took the moment to reflect on where we are and where I want our nation to be.pic.twitter.com/IrLWxOXqJb
text:
It was my honor to preside over the Chamber as @RepTedDeutch led a moment of silence before reading the names of the 17 who were killed in the shooting at Stoneman Douglas HS in Parkland last year.

I took the moment to reflect on where we are and where I want our nation to be.pic.twitter.com/IrLWxOXqJb

html: I am proud to be an original co-sponsor of #HR8. Today, we are working in @HouseJudiciary to #EndGunViolence. The overwhelming bipartisan support for universal background checks symbolizes the power of advocacy & the incredible power of survivors who share their stories.
text:
I am proud to be an original co-sponsor of #HR8. Today, we are working in @HouseJudiciary to #EndGunViolence.

The overwhelming bipartisan support for universal background checks symbolizes the power of advocacy & the incredible power of survivors who share their stories.

html: Happening soon: @HouseJudiciary will markup #HR8 and #HR1112, bills to close the background check loopholes for gun sales. #EndGunViolence Watch live:https://youtu.be/8u8NuXDyQ8k
text:
Happening soon: @HouseJudiciary will markup #HR8 and #HR1112, bills to close the background check loopholes for gun sales. #EndGunViolence 

Watch live:https://youtu.be/8u8NuXDyQ8k

text: I hope we will all continue to have these important conversations. Thank you @RepUnderwood & thank you to @Google for having us! #CBCWomen #BlackHistoryMonthhttps://twitter.com/RepUnderwood/status/1095393963903799296 …

html: On Saturday, @RepLucyMcBath's son, Jordan, who lost is life due to gun violence in 2012, would have turned 24 years old. Rep. McBath: "Everything that I wanted him to be is what drives me now."pic.twitter.com/pUnNLEjoUk
text:
On Saturday, @RepLucyMcBath's son, Jordan, who lost is life due to gun violence in 2012, would have turned 24 years old. 

Rep. McBath: "Everything that I wanted him to be is what drives me now."pic.twitter.com/pUnNLEjoUk

html: Every day, journalists around the world - just like Ahmed - risk their lives to expose truth & hold those in power accountable. Too many face intimidation & violence for doing work that is vital to democracy. This piece highlights why we must stand up for global press freedom:https://twitter.com/PostOpinions/status/1093839933301813253 …
text:
Every day, journalists around the world - just like Ahmed - risk their lives to expose truth & hold those in power accountable.

Too many face intimidation & violence for doing work that is vital to democracy.

This piece highlights why we must stand up for global press freedom:https://twitter.com/PostOpinions/status/1093839933301813253 …

html: Today, and every day, I stand with gun violence survivors and advocates. On Wednesday, one day before the anniversary of Parkland, we will hold a markup in @HouseJudiciary on #HR8, the Bipartisan Background Checks Act. Together, we are #TakingAction to #EndGunViolence.https://twitter.com/HouseJudiciary/status/1093554872102932481 …
text:
Today, and every day, I stand with gun violence survivors and advocates.

On Wednesday, one day before the anniversary of Parkland, we will hold a markup in @HouseJudiciary on #HR8, the Bipartisan Background Checks Act.

Together, we are #TakingAction to #EndGunViolence.https://twitter.com/HouseJudiciary/status/1093554872102932481 …

html: Today @HouseJudiciary held the first hearing on gun violence in nearly a decade. I shared the story of my son, Jordan, a victim of gun violence. Our stories are vitally important as we work to pass common-sense legislation to #EndGunViolence. Congress finally is #TakingAction.pic.twitter.com/tz6SdGQiid
text:
Today @HouseJudiciary held the first hearing on gun violence in nearly a decade.

I shared the story of my son, Jordan, a victim of gun violence.

Our stories are vitally important as we work to pass common-sense legislation to #EndGunViolence.

Congress finally is #TakingAction.pic.twitter.com/tz6SdGQiid

html: Gun violence has touched far too many of us. Today, gun violence victims, survivors, and advocates gathered at the #SOTU19 to tell their stories and highlight the need for common-sense gun safety solutions. Our country must do better. #SOTU2EndGunViolencepic.twitter.com/QNQGL55qEG
text:
Gun violence has touched far too many of us.

Today, gun violence victims, survivors, and advocates gathered at the #SOTU19 to tell their stories and highlight the need for common-sense gun safety solutions.

Our country must do better.

#SOTU2EndGunViolencepic.twitter.com/QNQGL55qEG

html: Just three months ago, Jeff & Margaret Binkley lost their beautiful daughter, Maura, in a shooting at a yoga studio in Tallahassee, Florida. These Dunwoody parents will join me in D.C. for the #SOTU2019 to tell Maura's story & advocate for common-sense gun safety solutions.pic.twitter.com/1c9PhrouxK
text:
Just three months ago, Jeff & Margaret Binkley lost their beautiful daughter, Maura, in a shooting at a yoga studio in Tallahassee, Florida.
 
These Dunwoody parents will join me in D.C. for the #SOTU2019 to tell Maura's story & advocate for common-sense gun safety solutions.pic.twitter.com/1c9PhrouxK

html: Every #BlackHistoryMonth I have celebrated the accomplishments of those who have come before me. This one is particularly special, as I stand on the shoulders of giants and strive to make a pathway for those who will come after me.
text:
Every #BlackHistoryMonth I have celebrated the accomplishments of those who have come before me. 

This one is particularly special, as I stand on the shoulders of giants and strive to make a pathway for those who will come after me.

html: Last night I talked with Mayor Joe Lockwood of @cityofmiltonga. I was honored to attend the State of the City, and look forward to many more great events in Milton!pic.twitter.com/ETBngSuiHo
text: Last night I talked with Mayor Joe Lockwood of @cityofmiltonga. I was honored to attend the State of the City, and look forward to many more great events in Milton!pic.twitter.com/ETBngSuiHo

html: I spoke on the House floor for the victims of gun violence that we don’t always talk about. The mothers, the fathers who have suffered tragic loss - the voices that we don’t always hear. We need policy, we need change, and we cannot wait any longer.pic.twitter.com/x0kPUtDqC2
text:
I spoke on the House floor for the victims of gun violence that we don’t always talk about. 

The mothers, the fathers who have suffered tragic loss - the voices that we don’t always hear. 

We need policy, we need change, and we cannot wait any longer.pic.twitter.com/x0kPUtDqC2

html: “I am now everything that I was fighting for in my son.” Listen to my full interview with @Lawrence on @TheLastWord to hear about how I fight for my district every day I am in Congress.pic.twitter.com/QllwA9jLYU
text:
“I am now everything that I was fighting for in my son.” 

Listen to my full interview with @Lawrence on @TheLastWord to hear about how I fight for my district every day I am in Congress.pic.twitter.com/QllwA9jLYU

html: My father was President of the Illinois NAACP for over 20 years. I grew up in marches demanding more from our government. When it comes to voting rights, my daddy’s work is not yet done. Today @HouseJudiciary held our first hearing on #HR1, the #ForThePeople Act.pic.twitter.com/634T32fQVz
text:
My father was President of the Illinois NAACP for over 20 years. I grew up in marches demanding more from our government. 

When it comes to voting rights, my daddy’s work is not yet done. Today @HouseJudiciary held our first hearing on #HR1, the #ForThePeople Act.pic.twitter.com/634T32fQVz

html: Stay safe tonight! Fulton, Cobb, and DeKalb counties have cancelled school tomorrow. Be careful of ice, stay off the roads, and follow @NWSAtlanta for updates.https://twitter.com/NWSAtlanta/status/1089967658743881729 …
text:
Stay safe tonight! 

Fulton, Cobb, and DeKalb counties have cancelled school tomorrow. Be careful of ice, stay off the roads, and follow @NWSAtlanta for updates.https://twitter.com/NWSAtlanta/status/1089967658743881729 …

html: On #HolocaustRemembranceDay we remember the six million Jews and millions of others who were murdered during the Holocaust. We honor the lives of those who were killed and recommit to our moral obligation to speak out against injustice and evil in all forms. #NeverAgainpic.twitter.com/gP2fJ63CYi
text:
On #HolocaustRemembranceDay we remember the six million Jews and millions of others who were murdered during the Holocaust.

We honor the lives of those who were killed and recommit to our moral obligation to speak out against injustice and evil in all forms. #NeverAgainpic.twitter.com/gP2fJ63CYi

html: Thankful that federal workers and their families have some relief for now, but I’m disappointed that the Senate & President upended lives & held paychecks hostage 35 days. In 3 weeks, I hope those lawmakers place the needs & wellbeing of the American people over petty politics.https://twitter.com/nytimes/status/1088987657592541184 …
text:
Thankful that federal workers and their families have some relief for now, but I’m disappointed that the Senate & President upended lives & held paychecks hostage 35 days.

In 3 weeks, I hope those lawmakers place the needs & wellbeing of the American people over petty politics.https://twitter.com/nytimes/status/1088987657592541184 …

html: Day 34 of the president's shutdown: Hundreds of thousands of federal workers tasked w/ keeping us safe are still working without pay. I'm deeply concerned for TSA agents & air traffic controllers at Atlanta's airport, & those working keep the public safe during the Super Bowl.pic.twitter.com/mKQPrpGDyp
text:
Day 34 of the president's shutdown:

Hundreds of thousands of federal workers tasked w/ keeping us safe are still working without pay.

I'm deeply concerned for TSA agents & air traffic controllers at Atlanta's airport, & those working keep the public safe during the Super Bowl.pic.twitter.com/mKQPrpGDyp

html: Telling your story is one of the most powerful actions you can take. As we work to reopen the government, I would be honored if you allowed me to tell your story of how the government shutdown has impacted you and your family. Tell me your story here https://goo.gl/forms/18hdqk88eNiUDDrA2 …
text: Telling your story is one of the most powerful actions you can take. As we work to reopen the government, I would be honored if you allowed me to tell your story of how the government shutdown has impacted you and your family. Tell me your story here https://goo.gl/forms/18hdqk88eNiUDDrA2 …

html: Today I prayed, marched, and spoke in honor of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. It is time we demand our leaders uphold his teachings through their actions and not just their words. Our communities, our state, and our nation depend on it.pic.twitter.com/ALg8Tvs9NK
text: Today I prayed, marched, and spoke in honor of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. It is time we demand our leaders uphold his teachings through their actions and not just their words. Our communities, our state, and our nation depend on it.pic.twitter.com/ALg8Tvs9NK

html: The shutdown is hurting Americans here in Georgia and across the nation. Time and again, I have joined my colleagues in voting to reopen the government. We have done our job. It's time for the Senate and the President to do theirs.
text: The shutdown is hurting Americans here in Georgia and across the nation. Time and again, I have joined my colleagues in voting to reopen the government. We have done our job. It's time for the Senate and the President to do theirs.

html: I met with union members who don't know when their next paychecks will come. Bills don't stop because the government is shut down. 30 days into this shutdown and without a source of income, many men and women are struggling to make ends meet.pic.twitter.com/MHzQfflS7S
text: I met with union members who don't know when their next paychecks will come. Bills don't stop because the government is shut down. 30 days into this shutdown and without a source of income, many men and women are struggling to make ends meet.pic.twitter.com/MHzQfflS7S

html: This weekend, I met with members of our community who are impacted by the government shutdown. Patti and her family were kind enough to welcome me into their home. They don't know when her next paycheck will come because she can't go back to work until this shutdown ends.pic.twitter.com/yiE3zP2NQy
text:
This weekend, I met with members of our community who are impacted by the government shutdown.

Patti and her family were kind enough to welcome me into their home. They don't know when her next paycheck will come because she can't go back to work until this shutdown ends.pic.twitter.com/yiE3zP2NQy

html: The @AMarch4OurLives students are an inspiration. I am proud to stand with them in the fight to keep our communities safe.pic.twitter.com/keZdfnVr0e

html: I am proud to co-sponsor #HR1, the most transformative package of democratic reforms in over 40 years. #HR1 Enacts: - Automatic voter registration - End of partisan gerrymandering - More transparent campaign finance laws - Stronger ethics enforcement
text:
I am proud to co-sponsor #HR1, the most transformative package of democratic reforms in over 40 years. 

#HR1 Enacts:
- Automatic voter registration
- End of partisan gerrymandering
- More transparent campaign finance laws
- Stronger ethics enforcement

html: Had a great time welcoming the newly-elected women members into the Congressional Black Caucus today! The CBC is now the largest it’s ever been. Proud of this moment.pic.twitter.com/DbHWoLwaiC
text: Had a great time welcoming the newly-elected women members into the Congressional Black Caucus today! The CBC is now the largest it’s ever been. Proud of this moment.pic.twitter.com/DbHWoLwaiC

html: I have beaten breast cancer twice - I know how important it is that we fight to cover those with pre-existing conditions. That is why today I proudly voted to defend the #ACA, and to make it easier to get quality and affordable health insurance.
text:
I have beaten breast cancer twice - I know how important it is that we fight to cover those with pre-existing conditions. 

That is why today I proudly voted to defend the #ACA, and to make it easier to get quality and affordable health insurance.

html: Federal employees, small business owners, and every taxpayer in this country deserve a government that works. That is why I voted today to allow families to receive their tax refunds on time, and to re-open the Small Business Administration.https://www.npr.org/2019/01/09/683519210/air-travelers-and-workers-may-feel-government-shutdown-effects …

html: The road to change is long, but with a lot of dedicated activists and legislators progress is possible. I am proud to stand with my colleagues in co-sponsoring H.R. 8, a bill which would implement universal background checks.pic.twitter.com/KYWMvCu7gC
text:
The road to change is long, but with a lot of dedicated activists and legislators progress is possible. 

I am proud to stand with my colleagues in co-sponsoring H.R. 8, a bill which would implement universal background checks.pic.twitter.com/KYWMvCu7gC
